results.title: Three looms waiting (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ronald Smedley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Omnibus”
Portrait of an English drama teacher, Dorothy Heathcote. Shows her work in Tyneside with a variety of young people from an approved school, a junior school, and a hospital for the mentally handicapped.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Three little pigs
results.creator_credit: Ursula Kolbe, Tim Fox and Classroom Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from around the world”.
An interpretation of the traditional tale of the Big Bad Wolf and the Three Little Pigs. Uses a combination of hand puppets, simple props and dramatic storytelling to provide a wealth of ideas that could easily be reproduced for use in the classroom. Accompanied by Teacher’s Notes.

results.title: Three little kittens
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Arthur Gates and Ernest Horn
results.brief_description: A farmer’s wife discovers three little kittens with their mother in the barn. When they are two weeks old, the mother cat carries them to a new home in an old buggy, where they learn to feed and clean themselves and to play. As they grow, they meet other animals and learn to catch mice. Two of the kittens are given to local tradesmen to catch mice in their shops while the third stays on the farm with its mother to help catch mice in the barn.

results.title: Three in One Aerobics Programme
results.creator_credit: Charles Cochrane, Grant Donovan and Steve Graham
results.brief_description: The aerobic program includes: 1. Loco Warm-Up. - 2. Stretching. - 3. Aerobic Introduction. - 4. Aerobic Standing. - 5. Aerobic Circuit. - 6. Aerobic Floor. - 7. Cool Down Stretch. - 8. Relaxation.

results.title: Three girls at the UN
results.brief_description: The United Nations, an international organisation, is exemplified in the activity of three UN girl guides during one day. An Indonesian, an American and an Iranian are seen performing their duties at the UN building in New York and participating in social activities; a similar life to the 140 other international civil servants.

results.title: Three fox fables
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Grace Storm
results.brief_description: This film brings to life on the screen three of the immortal tales of Aesop. The fox is seen in his encounters with a crow and a piece of cheese; with a stork; and with the proverbial bunch of grapes. The photography of these animals is the result of more than a year’s patient work by Lynwood Chase, well-known American naturalist and photographer.
